snippet: The Government Development Bank for Puerto Rico did not make a $58 million bond payment, saying it lacked the funds to meet the amount due.
abstract: Puerto Rico defaults on $58 million bond payment, risky move that has intensified speculation about territory's grim financial future; cites failure of legislature to appropriate necessary funds; move could increase pressure on creditors for debt renegotiation, but will also make it more difficult for territory to borrow in future.
lead_paragraph: The Government Development Bank for Puerto Rico did not make a $58 million bond payment, saying it lacked the funds to meet the amount due.

headline.main: Puerto Rico Defaults on Bond Payment
headline.print_headline: Puerto Rico Fails to Pay $58 Million Bond Debt

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Government Development Bank for Puerto Rico
